alert.note: Alert for Northwest Pocahontas; Northwest Webster; Southeast Pocahontas; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 5:26PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Randolph, central Pocahontas and southeastern Webster Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 525 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Webster Springs, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marlinton, Cass Scenic Railroad, Addison (Webster Springs), Snowshoe, Edray, Slaty Fork, Minnehaha Springs and Bergoo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Charleston West Virginia. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northeastern West Virginia.
